greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the minimum number that is the first of k > 1 consecutive integers whose sum equals n, or 0 if impossible.
reference: Alfred S. Posamentier, Math Charmers, Tantalizing Tidbits for the Mind, Prometheus Books, NY, 2003, page 67.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16416
formula: a(n)=1 iff n is a triangular number (A000217).
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{r = Ceiling[n/2]}, If[ IntegerQ[ Log[2, n]], 0, m = Range[r]; lst = Flatten[ Table[ m[[k]], {i, r}, {j, i + 1, r}, {k, i, j}], 1]; lst[[ Position[ Plus @@@ lst, n, 1, 1][[1, 1]], 1]]]]; Table[ f[n], {n, 93}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 25 2005 *)
program: (PARI) A104512(n) = if(!bitand(n,n-1), 0, my(b,d,u=1+sqrtint(2*n)); for(k=0,n-2,b = binomial(k+1,2); forstep(j=min(n,k+u),k+2,-1, d = binomial(j+1,2) - b; if(d==n,return(1+k),if(d<n,break)))); (0)); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 30 2021
results.author: Alfred S. Posamentier (asp2(AT)juno.com) and _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 23 2005
